page.title: 01General view of Brinklow
page.content: Brinklow village,population 1178, lies on the junction formed by the Fosse Way and the Coventry Road and is approximately mid-way between Coventry and Rugby, which is central to the region's{transport}network. The main shopping area, aptly named Broad Street, boasts a wide variety of {amenities}and{housing.}At the end of the village past the 13th Century {church}stands the{village school}whose playground is bordered by the earthworks of the{Motte and Bailey. Approximately 2.5 miles from Brinklow is the{Historic House}of Coombe Abbey with its Country Park full of a rich variety of wild life.To the north of Coombe Abbey lies the large industrial site of Rolls Royce,the main centre of {employment}in this block. All these places are linked by a mixture of different{farmland.
